reference_summary:
Last of the Summer Wine: Vintage 1985
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy
['"The world’s longest-running sitcom is back with more adventures from everyone’s favorite geriatrics! The year is 1985. Among many other things, Compo, Clegg and Foggy attempt to settle a question involving Nora Battys feet, an old mattress dumped in the countryside prompts Foggy to institute the Dewhirst Campaign for a Cleaner Countryside, and with the assistance of Comp & Clegg, Foggy sets out to show Digby’s donkey who\'s the boss. "']
{'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Various', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '4 hours and 59 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 0.8 Ounces', 'Item model number': '5957799', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '4 hours and 59 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 7, 2010', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Studio': 'BBC Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Clean intelligent humor. I am so tired of during on the television to see and hear the subject matter that dominates the entertainment airwaves....sexually explicit themes, violence to the point of special effects to " shock" the already jaded mind, and other trash. The " Last of the Summer Wine" is one of the clearest funniest, most simply creative shows I have ever seen. Leave it to the English!
CLEAN intelligent comedy. Not for many.
Last of the Summer Wine: Vintage 1977 (Season 4) (Dbl DVD)
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, BBC, All BBC Titles
['Last of the Summer Wine: Vintage 1977 (Season 4) (Dbl DVD)', 'The picturesque Pennine village of Holmfirth in the Yorkshire Dales is the setting for this vintage comedy,which first began life in 1973. This is Brontë country miles and miles of unspoilt moorland and a breath-taking backdrop to the antics of our ageing delinquents and their demented friends.', ']]>']

If you hate camp dirty explicit American trash t.v. then you may enjoy a bit of clean English humor. Refreshing and intellectual.
Pro pure entertainment!
Last of the Summer Wine: Vintage 1976 (Season 3) (DVD)
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, BBC, All BBC Titles
['Last of the Summer Wine: Vintage 1976 (Season 3) (DVD)', 'The picturesque Pennine village of Holmfirth in the Yorkshire Dales is the setting for this vintage comedy, which first began life in 1973. This is Brontë country miles and miles of unspoilt moorland and a breath-taking backdrop to the antics of our ageing delinquents and their demented friends. Last of the Summer Wine has a strong ensemble cast of characters, though there has always been a central trio.', ']]>']
{'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Various', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Mono)', 'Runtime': '3 hours and 26 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '3707458', 'Director': 'Various', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '3 hours and 26 minutes', 'Release date': 'March 11, 2008', 'Actors': 'Various', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'BBC Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'}
I am almost afraid to rate this series five star. The American market limits the availability of this series hence the higher prices and low availability . I am collecting these and don't t want the competition.
Stick with your American "drag ". Let the media manipulate your preferences.

Foul Play
Goldie Hawn  (Actor),     Chevy Chase  (Actor),     Colin Higgins  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Paramount Home Entertainment, Comedy
['Foul Play (DVD)', 'Beware of the Dwarf, whispers the hitchhiker to the beautiful librarian (Goldie Hawn) as he dies midway through a screening of This Gun Is Mine. Suddenly, Hawn is propelled into a world of wild chases, bizarre attemp ts on her life, and deadly encounters with an as sortment of weird under world characters. Academy Award winner Hawn teams with Chevy Chase (in h is first starring motion picture assi gnment) - and with hilarious resul ts. Chase plays the handsome San Francisco detective who becomes persona lly and professionally inv olved with all the off things happening to Ha wn. Costarring a pre-Arthur Dudley Moore in one of his most delightful c omic turns.', ']]>']
{'Genre': 'Mystery & Suspense/Thrillers, Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Ion Teodorescu, Marilyn Sokol, Rachel Roberts, Brian Dennehy, Pat Ast, Colin Higgins, Goldie Hawn, Burgess Meredith, Eugene Roche, Dudley Moore, Chuck McCann, Marc Lawrence, Cooper Huckabee, Chevy Chase, Billy Barty, Don Calfa, Bruce Solomon, John HancockIon Teodorescu, Marilyn Sokol, Rachel Roberts, Brian Dennehy, Pat Ast, Colin Higgins, Goldie Hawn, Burgess Meredith, Eugene Roche, Dudley Moore, Chuck McCann, Marc Lawrence, Cooper Huckabee, Chevy Chase, Billy Barty, Don Calfa, Bruce Solomon, John Hancock  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 57 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '26341194', 'Director': 'Colin Higgins', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 57 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 16, 2004', 'Actors': 'Goldie Hawn, Chevy Chase, Burgess Meredith, Rachel Roberts, Eugene Roche', 'Studio': 'Paramount', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Foul Play is one of the best movies that I have ever seen. It is clean and extremely funny!
Five Stars
Coming To America
Various  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
['Coming To America (DVD)', 'Coming to America casts comedian Eddie Murphy as pampered African prince Akeem, who rebels against an arranged marriage and heads to America to find a new bride. Murphy\'s regal father (James Earl Jones) agrees to al low the prince 40 days to roam the U.S., sending the prince\'s faithful r etainer Semmi (Arsenio Hall) along to make sure nothing untoward happens . To avoid fortune hunters, Prince Ak eem conceals his true identity and gets a "Joe job" at a fast-food restaurant. Murphy and Hall play multip le roles, and there are in numerable celebrity cameos peppered throughou t the proceedings — including the Duke Brothers (Don Ameche and Ralph Be llamy) from Tra ding Places. Coming to America made further headlines wh en humorist Art Buchwald sued the film\'s producers for plagiarizing one of h is works. Buchwald carried the case to trial, where he won a sizeab le judgement against the film\'s producers.', ']]>']

Eddie Murphy and Arsenio Hall are so ingenious in this comedy.  It is one of my favorites!
Five Stars

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Preferred Genre:** Comedy, particularly appreciating light-hearted, intelligent humor grounded in classic British and American comedic traditions.
- **Content Taste:** Exhibits a strong preference for clean, non-explicit themes while firmly disapproving of sexual content, excessive violence, and media prioritizing shock value over quality storytelling.
- **Cultural Appreciation:** An avid admirer of British humor and nostalgic narratives, particularly from classic television series, while cultivating an appreciation for vintage American comedies that align with similar values.
- **Critical Approach:** A discerning observer with a history of high ratings (typically 5.0), providing thoughtful commentary on contemporary entertainment and expressing clear disdain for low-quality offerings.
- **Format Preference:** Passionate about collecting physical media, especially DVDs and boxed sets, reflecting a preference for ownership over digital streaming options.
- **Recent Engagement:** The acquisition of a complete series and movie reflects a steadfast commitment to wholesome entertainment, highlighting enthusiasm for intellectually stimulating humor. The user continually emphasizes the importance of clean themes in entertainment choices, maintaining a critical viewpoint even towards highly-rated content.

This profile underscores the user's enduring quest for classic and nostalgic collections while aligning personal values with entertainment choices, further cementing their role as a thoughtful and insightful consumer.
